definitions.definition: An arrangement of two or more weapons so each can fire diagonally at something in front of a line between them.
The danger to a third party passing between two belligerents firing at one another.
examples: The two factions were either side of the road. A civilian lorry was caught in the crossfire and became collateral damage

definitions.definition: The danger to a third party passing between a gunman and his target.
A heated confrontation between opposing factions .
